message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.NE, cs.CV 

This paper focuses on modelling numerals with language models, which is a task related to natural language processing (NLP). Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CL (Computation and Language). The paper proposes a novel neural architecture, which involves training a continuous probability density function, indicating that it could also fall under cs.LG (Machine Learning). The use of hierarchical models to distinguish numerals from words suggests that the paper could also be classified under cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). The evaluation of the proposed model on clinical and scientific datasets indicates that it could be relevant to cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing). Finally, the use of language models to work with numbers could also be relevant to cs.CV (Computer Vision), as it could be applied to tasks such as reading numbers from images.
